title: Event Emitter
statementMd:
Implement an event emitter that supports subscribe, unsubscribe, and emit.

Process a list of operations and output event logs.

**Example:**
```
subscribe click handler1
emit click data1
unsubscribe click handler1
emit click data2

Output:
handler1: data1
```
template:
function processEvents(operations)
    local emitter = {}
    local logs = {}
    -- Your code here
    
    return logs
end

local ops = {}
while true do
    local line = readline()
    if not line then break end
    table.insert(ops, line)
end
local result = processEvents(ops)
for _, log in ipairs(result) do
    print(log)
end

tests.input:
subscribe click handler1
emit click data1
unsubscribe click handler1
emit click data2

title: Raycasting Simulation
statementMd:
Given a ray origin and direction, and a list of axis-aligned boxes, find which box the ray hits first.

**Example:**
```
Origin: (0, 0, 0), Direction: (1, 0, 0)
Boxes: [(5, -1, -1) to (7, 1, 1)]
Output: Box 1 at distance 5
```
template:
function raycast(origin, direction, boxes)
    -- Your code here
    
end

local originParts = readnumbers()
local dirParts = readnumbers()
local origin = Vector3.new(originParts[1], originParts[2], originParts[3])
local direction = Vector3.new(dirParts[1], dirParts[2], dirParts[3])

local numBoxes = readnumber()
local boxes = {}
for i = 1, numBoxes do
    local parts = readnumbers()
    table.insert(boxes, {
        min = Vector3.new(parts[1], parts[2], parts[3]),
        max = Vector3.new(parts[4], parts[5], parts[6])
    })
end

local result = raycast(origin, direction, boxes)
if result then
    print("Box " .. result.index .. " at " .. string.format("%.1f", result.distance))
else
    print("No hit")
end

```
Output: 4
```
template:
function shortestPath(grid)
    -- Your code here
    
end

local rows = readnumber()
local grid = {}
for i = 1, rows do
    local row = readnumbers()
    table.insert(grid, row)
end
print(shortestPath(grid))

title: Trie Implementation
statementMd:
Implement a Trie (prefix tree) that supports insert, search, and startsWith.

**Example:**
```
insert apple
insert app
search apple -> true
search app -> true
search ap -> false
startsWith ap -> true
```
template:
function createTrie()
    local trie = {}
    -- Your code here
    
    return trie
end

local trie = createTrie()
local results = {}
while true do
    local line = readline()
    if not line then break end
    local parts = string.split(line, " ")
    local op = parts[1]
    local word = parts[2]
    if op == "insert" then
        trie:insert(word)
    elseif op == "search" then
        table.insert(results, trie:search(word) and "true" or "false")
    elseif op == "startsWith" then
        table.insert(results, trie:startsWith(word) and "true" or "false")
    end
end
for _, r in ipairs(results) do
    print(r)
end

tests.input:
insert apple
insert app
search apple
search app
search ap
startsWith ap

title: LRU Cache
statementMd:
Implement an LRU (Least Recently Used) cache with get and put operations.

**Example:**
```
capacity = 2
put 1 1
put 2 2
get 1 -> 1
put 3 3 (evicts key 2)
get 2 -> -1
```
template:
function createLRUCache(capacity)
    local cache = {}
    -- Your code here
    
    return cache
end

local capacity = readnumber()
local cache = createLRUCache(capacity)
local results = {}
while true do
    local line = readline()
    if not line then break end
    local parts = string.split(line, " ")
    local op = parts[1]
    if op == "get" then
        table.insert(results, cache:get(tonumber(parts[2])))
    elseif op == "put" then
        cache:put(tonumber(parts[2]), tonumber(parts[3]))
    end
end
for _, r in ipairs(results) do
    print(r)
end
